subject: How to test threaded method?

messageBody:
I have a method that when called creates a thread and does all its work
in the new thread. It looks kind of like this:

public void doSomething()
{
Thread requestThread = new Thread()
{
public void run()
{
fireStartEvent();

//do some stuff that takes a long time

fireDoneEvent();
}
};
requestThread.start();
}

I would like to test this method to make sure it sends the correct
events in the correct order and that the EventObject contains the
correct data.

So I wrote a test that looks like this:


public void testDoSomething()
{
m_eventCount = 0;
final MockService service = new MockService();
service.addOperationListener(new OperationAdapter()
{
public void operationUpdate(OperationEvent event)
{
m_eventCount += 1;
}
});

service.doSomething();

assertEquals(2, m_eventCount);
}

My test fails because it reaches the assertEquals before all the events
can be fired. If I add a call to Thread.sleep after the call to
doSomething() then the test succeeds. Does anyone know a better way to
test this so I don't have to add a call to Thread.sleep?

Thanks,
Kris
